subtitle.text: The Emperor's Flowers
Long ago, there was an emperor who loved flowers.
He spent his days growing water lilies and orchids,
plum blossoms and pink peonies.
The emperor had no children.
That winter, he decided to choose a child to become the next emperor.
"Whoever grows the most beautiful flower will be the next emperor," he proclaimed.
One of the emperor's servants held out a jar of special seeds.
"Plant one of these seeds," he said, "and bring it back in the summer."
The emperor added, "No matter what, you must bring it back."

All the children were very excited when they heard the news,
and they lined up to take a flower seed.
Outside the city lived a poor young boy named Ping.
Like the emperor, Ping loved growing flowers.
I want to enter the contest, he said.
I'll take you to the palace, said his mother.
I'll buy you a flowerpot, said his father.

His father bought the nicest flowerpot the family could afford, 
and Ping and his mother went to the palace.
"Good luck," the servant said as he dropped a single seed into Ping's pot.
That spring, Ping planted the seed.
He watered it and cared for it, but nothing happened.
"Why isn't it growing?" he asked.
"Give it time," said his mother.
Summer came, and all of Ping's flowers grew big and beautiful.
But the emperor's seed did not grow.
"Why isn't it growing?" he asked again.
"It's okay, Ping," said his father.
"Don't worry about the contest."
Finally, the day came to return to the palace.

Ping looked at his empty flowerpot unhappily, but he remembered what the emperor had
said:
"No matter what, you must bring it back."
"I have to take the flower seed back to the palace," Ping said.
"Just tell him the truth," said his mother.
"We love you, no matter what," said his father.

As Ping walked to the palace, other boys and girls laughed at his simple, 
empty flowerpot.
"You can't show that to the emperor!" said a boy.
"The emperor will never choose you!" said a girl.
But Ping walked on.
At the palace, all the children waited to meet the emperor.
They held the most beautiful flowers Ping had ever seen.
They continued to laugh at Ping's empty pot.
"You don't even have a flower," said a girl.
"Go home!"
"The emperor should punish you!" yelled a boy.
Ping felt silly and sad, but he did not go home.
Finally, Ping stood before the great emperor.
"Where is your flower?" asked the emperor.
"I tried my best," said Ping,
"but this seed didn't grow."
Suddenly, the emperor smiled.
Then he said, "These seeds were boiled."
"Boiled?" asked Ping.
"Yes, they're boiled."
"Then," Ping said slowly,
"they'll never grow."
"That's right," said the emperor.
Ping smiled because he finally understood why his flower had not grown.
"All my other flowers are beautiful," he said.
The emperor laughed. "I'm sure they are," he said.
And so the great emperor chose Ping to be the next emperor.
"You're an honest boy," he said,
"so you will be a great emperor."
Ping bowed low.
"Thank you, your majesty," he said.

Ping and his parents moved into the palace, and Ping indeed became a great emperor
known for his kindness, his honesty, and his beautiful gardens.
